intro: Alsine weberbaueri, commonly known as the desert sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in desert environments. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh conditions. Alsine weberbaueri is part of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and specialized adaptations to desert life.
